span.p: UPDATE: On Thursday, April 9, 2020, Governor Wolf announced that Pennsylvania schools will remain closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 academic year. All facilities are closed until further notice. All events are cancelled or postponed until further notice.

The District’s Technology Department has established a technology support hotline for students only at 412-264-3013. The helpline will be staffed Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. – 2 p.m. during the closure. All calls received outside of this time frame will be recorded and returned in the order in which they were received.

span.p: This page will be updated frequently as we continue to communicate information with our Moon Area School District families throughout the COVID-19 school closure.

hr.p: Center for Disease Control and Prevention:

We know that the circumstances surrounding COVID-19 and the sudden change of daily routines can cause added stress on our students. Below are several emotional support resources for students coping with the pandemic:

p.a: Child Mind Institute: Talking to Kids About the Coronavirus
National Association of School Psychologists: Talking to Children about COVID-19 (Coronavirus): A Parent Resource
Western Psychiatric Hospital of UPMC: Information for Parents to Help Their Children Deal With Anxiety During the COVID-19 Pandemic
Social Care Network: Free or reduced cost resources in your area

hr.p: MilitaryShare Food Program - Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank

MASD is committed to helping families in need. Feeding our children is essential to their wellbeing and we have continued to prepare and deliver meals. If your child(ren) is in need of meals during the COVID-19 extended break, please contact cleininger@moonarea.net.
Resources for families without internet in their homes:

The District’s Technology Department has established a hotline for technology support for students at 412-264-3013. The helpline will be staffed Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. – 2 p.m. during the closure. All calls received outside of this time frame will be recorded and returned in the order in which they were received.

div.h1: Equal Opportunity and Title IX Statement

div.p: Moon Area School District (MASD) does not discriminate in its educational programs, activities or employment practices based on race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, religion, ancestry, genetic information or any other legally-protected category. Announcement of this policy is in accordance with State Law including the Pennsylvania Human Relations Act and with Federal law, including Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 and the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. For more information, please contact the Title IX Coordinator, Amy Finnegan, at 8353 University Boulevard, Moon Township, PA 15108 or 412-264-9440 x1125.
